item.title: Sunil Gavaskar Wants India To Drop Out-Of-Form Star, Says "Be Brutally..." - NDTV Sports
item.description:
Sunil Gavaskar Wants India To Drop Out-Of-Form Star, Says "Be Brutally..."

Date: December 26, 2024

Source: NDTV

Legendary batter Sunil Gavaskar has shared a candid review of pacer Mohammed Siraj's performance, urging that he be dropped from the Indian team due to his poor form in the ongoing Border Gavaskar Trophy series.

  • Gavaskar highlights Siraj's disappointing performance, having taken only 13 wickets in seven innings.
  • Siraj has the highest runs conceded per over among frontline pacers in the series, averaging 4.07 runs per over.
  • Gavaskar argues for a direct approach in communicating performance issues to Siraj.
  • He suggests bringing back Harshit Rana or introducing Prasidh Krishna for the fifth Test in Sydney.
“You need to be brutally upfront and say 'look, your performance has not been up to scratch, and therefore you are being dropped.'” - Sunil Gavaskar

In conclusion, Gavaskar emphasizes the need for clear communication regarding performance expectations for players in the team.

item.title: "Double Standards": Irfan Pathan, Sunil Gavaskar Slam Australia Experts Over Virat Kohli Bashing - NDTV Sports
item.description: No summary available for this article. Click the link to read more.

item.title: Smith inside top 10 for most Test centuries following MCG classic - ICC Cricket
item.description:
Smith inside top 10 for most Test centuries following MCG classic

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Not specified

Smith's effort at the MCG was his second century on the trot, following his innings of 101 against India during the third Test of this series at the Gabba.

  • Smith has now made consecutive centuries, marking his return to form.
  • Before these innings, he struggled to reach triple figures since the Ashes in mid-2023.
  • He emphasized the importance of faith during his period of low scores.
  • Smith is now second among Australian players in Test centuries, trailing Ricky Ponting's 41 by seven centuries.
“You got to have faith that you are going to turn it around and just trust the processes.” - Steve Smith

This performance is a significant turnaround for Smith, solidifying his status among cricket's elite batsmen.

item.title: Watch: Jasprit Bumrah's Cold Celebration As He Dismisses Travis Head For Duck - NDTV Sports
item.description: No summary available for this article. Click the link to read more.

item.title: Watch: Furious Virat Kohli Confronts As Australian Fans Stoop To Absolute Low, Guard Intervenes - NDTV Sports
item.description:
Virat Kohli Confronts Australian Fans During Boxing Day Test

Date: December 27, 2024 | Source: NDTV

During the Boxing Day Test against Australia, Virat Kohli faced hostility from fans at the Melbourne Cricket Ground after his dismissal, leading to a tense moment requiring intervention from security.

  • Kohli scored 36 runs but faced boos as he left the field.
  • A group of Australian fans hurled derogatory remarks at him.
  • Kohli turned to confront the fans but was calmed down by security.
  • This incident follows Kohli's controversial on-field behavior earlier in the Test.
  • India ended Day 2 at 164/5, trailing Australia by 310 runs.
“Virat Kohli almost recreated that incident with a CSK fan at Wankhede.” — Pari (@BluntIndianGal)

This incident adds to the scrutiny Kohli is facing from fans and media during this series.

item.title: Irfan Pathan, Sanjay Manjrekar collide on live TV over Virat Kohli-Yashasvi Jaiswal run-out: 'Fine, you only speak then' - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Irfan Pathan and Sanjay Manjrekar Clash Over Kohli-Jaiswal Run-Out on Live TV

Date: Dec 27, 2024 | Source: HT Sports

Former Indian cricketers Irfan Pathan and Sanjay Manjrekar had a heated exchange on live television regarding a critical run-out incident involving Virat Kohli and Yashasvi Jaiswal during a Test match against Australia.

  • Pathan and Manjrekar disagreed on the run-out of Jaiswal following a communication error with Kohli.
  • India was placed at 153/2 before losing three wickets for six runs due to the incident.
  • Manjrekar criticized Kohli for not being more proactive, while Pathan defended the non-striker's call in a heated debate.
  • Manjrekar suggested a new coaching manual based on Pathan's approach to running between wickets.
“If you don't want to listen, there isn't much left here,” said Manjrekar, highlighting the tensions during the debate.

Regardless of the argument, India's position in the game has weakened, trailing by 310 runs with five wickets down.

item.title: Virat Kohli provoked by Aussie spectator after getting out, cooled down by official just as India great about to unleash - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Virat Kohli lost his cool at a fan after he was seemingly provoked following his dismissal on 36 in the Boxing Day Test.

Date: Dec 27, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

Team India's star batter, Virat Kohli, faced provocations from Australian fans after his dismissal in the Boxing Day Test. Kohli appeared agitated after a comment from a spectator, prompting an official to intervene and calm him down.

  • Kohli was dismissed for 36 after a solid innings.
  • The Australian crowd booed Kohli as he left the field.
  • An official stepped in to prevent Kohli from confronting a fan.
  • Kohli was fined 20% of his match fees for a prior altercation in the match.
  • India reached 164/5 at the end of Day 2.
Kohli gestured to the crowd, seemingly encouraging them to boo louder.

This incident adds to the heated atmosphere surrounding Kohli during the Test series as tensions rise with the Australian crowd.

item.title: "If You Don't Let Me Talk...": Sanjay Manjrekar, Irfan Pathan In Heated Debate Over Jaiswal Run-Out - NDTV Sports
item.description:
If You Don't Let Me Talk...: Sanjay Manjrekar, Irfan Pathan In Heated Debate Over Jaiswal Run-Out

Publication Date: December 27, 2024

Source: NDTV

During a live discussion, former cricketers Sanjay Manjrekar and Irfan Pathan engaged in a heated debate over a controversial run-out incident involving Yashasvi Jaiswal and Virat Kohli during a Test match against Australia.

  • The incident occurred on Day 4 of the 4th Test, where Jaiswal and Kohli built a significant partnership of 102 runs.
  • A mix-up between the two players led to Jaiswal's dismissal, with differing opinions on who was at fault.
  • Manjrekar defended Jaiswal, stating Kohli should have responded to his call for a run, while Pathan argued Kohli acted rightly given the ball's speed.
  • The debate escalated, with Manjrekar claiming that if Kohli didn't want to let him talk, then that was acceptable.
  • Manjrekar later suggested that Kohli's own dismissal was influenced by guilt over the run-out incident involving Jaiswal.
“Kohli's dismissal probably also down to the guilt he had inside his heart over Jaiswal's run-out.” — Sanjay Manjrekar

This spirited discussion highlighted the tensions and varying perspectives among cricketers regarding crucial moments in the game.

item.title: What does India want?: Win BGT or bring Rohit Sharma back to form? - The Indian Express
item.description:
What does India want? Win BGT or bring Rohit Sharma back to form?

Publication Date: December 16, 2024 | Source: Indian Express

The article discusses the critical situation surrounding Rohit Sharma's form and his recent decision to open the batting in Test cricket. It argues whether this change is beneficial for Sharma and the team as they aim to retain the Border-Gavaskar Trophy.

  • Rohit Sharma's batting form has raised concerns as the Indian team plays against Australia in the Test series.
  • Critics suggest that Rohit's elevation to opener is not warranted, given his recent performances.
  • The article questions the timing and approach of Rohit as a top-order batsman.
  • It emphasizes the need for Rohit to be proactive and in sync with his batting strategy.
“That’s just a lazy, not switched on, not up for the moment type of shot.” – Ricky Ponting on Rohit's batting.

In conclusion, the team needs to focus on proper tactics instead of rearranging positions unnecessarily. Rohit must regain his form without further disrupting the existing batting order.

item.title: Australia’s late blitz blitz puts India on back foot on day two of Boxing Day Test – as it happened - The Guardian
item.description:
Boxing Day Test 2024: Australia vs India fourth men’s cricket Test, day two – live updates

Date: Fri 27 Dec 2024 02.15 EST

Source: Guardian

Day two of the Boxing Day Test witnessed a dramatic collapse from India, who lost three wickets for just 13 runs towards the end of play, leaving them trailing by 310 runs.

  • Australia declared at 474, with Steve Smith scoring 140 runs.
  • India was at 164-5 at stumps, with Rishabh Pant and Ravindra Jadeja at the crease.
  • Key wickets fell in quick succession, including that of Virat Kohli.
  • Sam Konstas had a standout debut on day one, setting the stage for Australia's batting dominance.
  • Jasprit Bumrah took four wickets for India, showing glimpses of resistance despite the team's collapse.
“All hope isn’t lost for India with the destructive pair of Pant and Jadeja at the crease but the deficit is more than chunky.”

The day ended with India in a precarious position, needing a strong performance from the lower order to recover from their latest batting failures.

item.title: Australia’s late wicket blitz puts India on back foot in Boxing Day Test - The Guardian
item.description:
Boxing Day Test 2024: Australia vs India fourth men’s cricket Test, day two – live updates

Date: Fri 27 Dec 2024

Source: The Guardian

Day two of the Boxing Day Test witnessed a dramatic collapse in India's innings. After a strong start, they lost wickets quickly towards the end of the session, ending at 164-5, trailing Australia by 310 runs.

  • Australia's total: All out for 474 with significant contributions from Steve Smith (140) and Sam Konstas (60 on debut).
  • India's performance: Jaiswal scored 82 runs before a crucial run out, while Kohli was dismissed for 35.
  • Wickets: India lost three wickets for just 13 runs as they stumbled towards the day's conclusion.
  • Key bowlers: Scott Boland claimed three wickets for Australia, turning the momentum in their favor.
“All hope isn’t lost for India with the destructive pair of Pant and Jadeja at the crease.”

In conclusion, Australia dominated the second day, and India's efforts to make a comeback are hindered as they face a daunting deficit.

item.description: No summary available for this article. Click the link to read more.

item.title: 'You've got to be switched on': Ricky Ponting slams Rohit Sharma's shot selection - The Times of India
item.description:
'You've got to be switched on': Ricky Ponting slams Rohit Sharma's shot selection

Publication Date: NEW DELHI, December 2023

Source: Times of India

This article discusses the criticism faced by Indian cricket captain Rohit Sharma regarding his shot selection during a Test match against Australia, particularly focusing on an ineffective pull shot that led to his early dismissal.

  • Rohit Sharma attempted a pull shot that resulted in his dismissal for just 3 runs during the Boxing Day Test.
  • His performance has been under scrutiny due to a significant slump in form, with only 22 runs in the series so far.
  • Former Australia captain Ricky Ponting criticized Sharma's lack of focus and decision-making at the crease.
  • Darren Lehmann and Michael Vaughan echoed similar sentiments, pointing out that Rohit needs to be more aggressive and committed in his play.
“That's just a lazy, not switched on, not up for the moment type of shot.” - Ricky Ponting

The critique from former players highlights the pressures on Rohit Sharma as a captain and his need to adapt and recover in the ongoing series against Australia.

item.title: LIVE Boxing Day Test: Konstas a fan fave for MCG crowd; Cummins delivery does the damage - The Age
item.description:
As it happened - India lose 3-6: Australia controlling MCG Test after half hour of power

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Associated Press

India struggled on the second day of the fourth Test, facing a mini-collapse that left them trailing after Australia set a strong total.

  • Australia scored 474 runs, led by Steve Smith’s 140.
  • India reached 5-164 at stumps, having lost three wickets for six runs in a dramatic conclusion to the day.
  • Key performances included Yashavi Jaiswal’s 82 and Virat Kohli’s 36.
  • India's captain Rohit Sharma was dismissed for just 3 runs, while K.L. Rahul scored 24 before being bowled by Pat Cummins.
  • Smith is now only 51 runs shy of reaching 10,000 career runs in Test cricket.
“I’m very happy with how I played today,” - Steve Smith

As the match progresses, India will need to recover quickly to stay competitive in the series.

item.title: India vs Australia 4th Test, Day 2 LIVE Score: Virat Kohli Nears 50 As India Fightback vs Aus; Yashasvi Jaiswal Solid - NDTV Sports
item.description:
India vs Australia 4th Test, Day 2 Highlights: India Hit Self-Destruct Button, Slump To 164/5 At Stumps

Date: Not specified
Source: NDTV

This article highlights the dismal performance of the Indian cricket team during the second day of the 4th Test against Australia, marking a significant slump in their batting.

  • India struggled to manage their batting, finishing the day at 164/5.
  • Key players fell cheaply, contributing to a self-destructive approach.
  • The Australian bowlers exploited the conditions effectively.
“It’s a disappointing display from the Indian batsmen, who seemed to lose their way after a promising start.”

The stark contrast in performance between India and Australia indicates a need for the Indian team to reassess their strategy ahead of the remaining days of the Test match.

item.title: “Bilkul disturb kiya unhone” - Sanjay Manjrekar slams Rohit Sharma for contradicting statement in BGT 2024-25 4th Test - Sportskeeda
item.description:
Sanjay Manjrekar Criticizes Rohit Sharma's Batting Decisions in BGT 2024-25

Date: December 2024, Source: Sportskeeda

Former India batter Sanjay Manjrekar slammed Rohit Sharma's decision to change the batting order, affecting the successful combination of KL Rahul and Yashasvi Jaiswal. Despite this, Sharma struggled with just three runs.

  • Manjrekar criticized Sharma for disrupting the batting order that had been effective in the first part of the series.
  • Sharma returned to the top of the order, pushing Rahul to No. 3 and dropping Shubman Gill.
  • Manjrekar emphasized the inconsistency in Sharma's statements about disrupting the team balance.
“When you play well against Australia, you are respected a lot. KL Rahul, who has been India's best batter in this series, has scored runs at the top, put on a record stand as well. India moved him out of his preferred position just so that Rohit Sharma can get an opportunity to return to form. This is the wrong way of thinking.” - Sanjay Manjrekar

This event has sparked discussions about team strategy and player management going forward in the series.

item.title: Hockey India League returns, franchises brace for 'exciting challenge', 'long haul' - ESPN India
item.description:
Hockey India League returns, franchises brace for 'exciting challenge', 'long haul'

Date: Dec 27, 2024 | Source: ESPN

Hockey India League's return is seen as vital for promoting the sport in India, building on past successes while addressing previous financial challenges.

Key Points:

  • The Hockey India League has resumed after halting in 2017 due to financial sustainability issues.
  • Franchise owners see potential in developing hockey, especially in Punjab and Haryana.
  • The league aims to attract investment and nurture talent while learning from past failures.
  • JSW Sports emphasizes the long-term vision for growth, comparing it to other sports leagues.
  • Owners express confidence in digital growth to boost viewership and engagement.

Notable Quotes:

“What is important is to grow the popularity in Gen Z.” - Divyanshu Singh, COO of JSW Sports
“We all are aware that it will take one or two seasons to build the property.” - Mahesh Bhupathi, CEO of SG Sports

In conclusion, stakeholders are optimistic about the league's revival, believing it can flourish due to lessons learned and growing interest in hockey.

item.title: Under-Fire Virat Kohli Walks Into Ground Amid Loud Boos From Fans In Melbourne. Video - NDTV Sports
item.description:
Under-Fire Virat Kohli Walks Into Ground Amid Loud Boos From Fans In Melbourne

Publication Date: December 27, 2024 | Source: NDTV

Virat Kohli was booed by Australian fans as he walked onto the field during the Boxing Day Test in Melbourne, following a controversial incident that led to him being fined by the ICC.

  • Kohli was penalized for a deliberate confrontation with Australian player Sam Konstas.
  • Despite the backlash, Indian fans attempted to counter the jeers with applause.
  • The incident has resulted in negative press for Kohli in Australia.
  • Konstas achieved an impressive performance against Kohli's team.
The Australia crowd booed king Kohli when he entered the ground #INDvsAUS #ViratKohli

This incident highlights the intense rivalry and pressure faced by players in international cricket.

item.title: India vs Australia 4th Test, Day 2 LIVE Score: Pat Cummins Invites Virat Kohli For Cover Drive, His Reply Floors All - NDTV Sports
item.description:
India vs Australia 4th Test, Day 2 LIVE Score Updates: Virat Kohli Nears 50 As India Fightback vs Aus; Yashasvi Jaiswal Solid

Date: December 27, 2024 Source: NDTV Sports

India put up a resilient performance on Day 2 of the 4th Test against Australia, with Jaiswal scoring a half-century and Kohli looking to follow suit. The team faced a setback with KL Rahul's dismissal just before Tea, but Jaiswal and Kohli continued to build a partnership aiming for a strong recovery.

  • Yashasvi Jaiswal completed his half-century in 81 balls.
  • Virat Kohli looked in good touch as he approaches his fifty.
  • India was at 51/2 at one point with Rohit Sharma's quick dismissal.
  • Australia set a solid total of 474 in their first innings.
  • Steve Smith played a crucial role with his 34th Test century.
"A massive wicket for India with KL Rahul knocked over by Pat Cummins right before Tea, which was a big blow for the team."

India aims to continue their fightback on Day 2, supported by a solid performance from Jaiswal and Kohli.

item.title: FIDE World Rapid and Blitz Chess Championships 2024: Carlsen struggles on first day; Arjun, Raunak, Harika top Indian performers - ESPN India
item.description:
FIDE World Rapid and Blitz Chess Championships 2024: Carlsen struggles on first day; Arjun, Raunak, Harika top Indian performers

Publication Date: Dec 27, 2024 Source: ESPN

The 2024 FIDE World Rapid and Blitz Championship commenced with World No. 1 Magnus Carlsen facing unexpected difficulties, securing only 2.5 points from 5 rounds, while young Indian players Arjun Erigaisi, Raunak Sadhwani, and Harika Dronavalli showcased strong performances.

  • Magnus Carlsen, the defending champion, suffered an upset against Denis Lazavik.
  • Arjun Erigaisi and Raunak Sadhwani were top performers from India, each scoring 4 out of 5 points.
  • 18-year-old Volodar Murzin leads the tournament with a score of 4.5/5.
  • Alice Lee tops the women's event with a perfect score of 4/4.
“A very, very poor performance” - Magnus Carlsen on his first day struggles.

The tournament is being held in New York's Wall Street, with more rounds scheduled for both men and women in the coming days.

item.title: Boxing Day Test: Rohit Sharma's return to opening slot lasts five balls - The Times of India
item.description:
Boxing Day Test: Rohit Sharma's Opening Return Cut Short

Date: December 27, 2024 Source: Times of India

India captain Rohit Sharma's return as an opener ended in just five balls during the Boxing Day Test against Australia, continuing his struggle for form.

  • Rohit Sharma scored only 3 runs before being dismissed by Pat Cummins.
  • Cummins has now dismissed Rohit seven times in 13 innings.
  • Steve Smith scored 140 runs for Australia, contributing to their total of 474 runs.
  • Rohit had previously struggled in the first two Tests of the series with only 19 runs.
“This is the seventh time that Cummins has dismissed Rohit in 13 innings.”

Despite the disappointing performance, Rohit's role as captain is essential for guiding the team moving forward.

item.title: PV Sindhu and husband Venkata Datta Sai seek blessings at Tirumala post wedding - Watch - The Times of India
item.description:
PV Sindhu and Husband Venkata Datta Sai Seek Blessings at Tirumala Post Wedding - Watch

Publication Date: October 2023

Source: Times of India

This article covers the recent visit of PV Sindhu and her husband Venkata Datta Sai to Tirumala, where they sought blessings following their wedding.

  • The couple visited the Tirumala temple to offer prayers.
  • The event attracted significant media attention.
  • Photos and videos of their visit were widely shared on social media.
“We feel blessed to have the support of our families and fans,” said PV Sindhu.

The couple's visit highlights the cultural significance of seeking blessings in India, especially after significant life events like marriage.

item.title: Failure at No.6, failure as an opener: Rohit Sharma dismissed for 3 runs after removing KL Rahul from the opening slot - Crictoday
item.description:
Rohit Sharma Struggles Again: Dismissed for Just 3 Runs

Publication Date: December 27, 2024 Source: cricket.com.au

In the latest Test match against Australia, Indian captain Rohit Sharma's batting woes continued as he scored only 3 runs, facing difficulties against the pace attack.

  • Rohit Sharma was dismissed after playing a lackluster shot against Pat Cummins.
  • This performance adds to his struggles, having failed in previous innings at No.6.
  • Shubman Gill was dropped to accommodate Rohit at the top of the batting order.
  • Rohit has struggled in the last eight Tests, particularly against pace bowlers.
  • After facing criticism, he claimed to be in good form during net sessions.
  • The prospect of him being dropped looms if his performance does not improve.
“I am not out of form as I am feeling good from inside. I am batting well in the nets.” — Rohit Sharma

The pressure is mounting on Rohit Sharma as he must deliver in the upcoming innings to secure his position in the team.

item.title: India vs Australia 4th Test, Day 2 LIVE Score: Rohit Sharma's Opening Stunt Flops As India Lose 1st Wicket - NDTV Sports
item.description:
India vs Australia 4th Test, Day 2 LIVE Score Updates

Date: Not specified | Source: NDTV

Live updates on the second day of the 4th Test match between India and Australia, highlighting key moments including a significant blow to India's KL Rahul.

  • Pat Cummins takes a crucial wicket for Australia.
  • India faces challenges in batting before the tea break.
  • Key performances and statistics from the match are under review.
“Pat Cummins' Ripper Hands India Big KL Rahul Blow Before Tea”

This match is crucial for both teams as they contend for vital points in the series.

item.title: LIVE Boxing Day Test: Australia all out for 474; Smith OUT in bizarre fashion - The Age
item.description:
LIVE Boxing Day Test - Australia’s triple strike: India lose 3-6 in horror half an hour

Date: December 27, 2024

Source: Channel Seven

The end of play could not come soon enough for India. In a dramatic collapse, they lost three wickets in just six runs, greatly shifting the momentum in favor of Australia.

  • India lost three crucial wickets for just six runs in approximately 23 deliveries.
  • Virat Kohli was dismissed after a poor run-out and a caught behind decision.
  • Yashasvi Jaiswal was run out due to confusion with Kohli, who was hesitant to run.
  • Scott Boland was instrumental for Australia, taking multiple wickets during this critical period.
  • At stumps, India was at 5-164, trailing by over 300 runs.
"That passage of play could be the Test match right there... a disaster for the tourists." - Chloe Saltau

The situation is concerning for India as they head into the next day of the Test match with significant pressure to recover from this sudden collapse.
